episode: I was very sad when my father died.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: My father died in 2016 and I was very sad when it happened.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I'm so sorry for your loss.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Thanks. I am mostly over it, it happened 9 years ago.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Time helps heal wounds, glad you're moving forward.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I tink when someone dies we run things through our head, things we should have said or did.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Regret and "what ifs" can be tough to shake.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: After he died I didn't have anyone to watch the Steeler games with.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Sounds like you shared a special bond over football.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yeah, I grew up in Pittsburgh in the 1970s when the Steelers were great.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: The Steel Curtain era, legendary!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Right, with Bradshaw and Joe Green. I was hooked on football since I was 7 or 8 years old.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Those childhood memories stick with you forever.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: They sure do. I thought the local football team just automatically wins the Super Bowl every year.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Ha! Childhood innocence, that's sweet!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I learned that wasn't true in the 1980s.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Reality check!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Anyway, since my dad died I watch the game at the club with some friends.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: New tradition, still keeping the spirit alive.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yeah, but it kind of isn't the same.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Miss the old routine with your dad.
